column4: How do I know if a dataprojector will work on my Ubuntu box? It's a Hitachi CP-RS55 - Google won't say.
try looking for your projector and linux
it would be in hardware support usb or the like
How do I know if a dataprojector will work on my Ubuntu box? It's a Hitachi CP-RS55 - Google won't say.
found this page for projectors http://www.spinics.net/linux/vidproj.php
hey... it's listed in there, but clicking the link just kicks me to Amazon.com. Interface? Dunno... how would I find out... lemme look around.
does it attach to video card jenda
I don't know, I've never had it in my hands. It says "Inputs: 1 composite, 1 S-Video, 1 VGA" on Amazon
well its does connect to video card or capture card either one
the vga input would kinda suggest it will just take a connection from the PC's monitor port, no?
it will hook right in place of monitor or if you have tv out you can use that
Yes, I sort of thought so, but wanted to make sure. Will it just appear as a monitor to my Ubuntu PC?
it might take some tweaking but should work fine
OK, thanks... the 'some tweaking' sounds a little scary... how deep would that go?
just a resalution change maybe jenda
Oh OK, that sounds good. Thanks for your help :)
